markdown.markdown:
### 1) Food Costs (at home vs away from home)

**What to study:** Size/timing of pass-through; category heterogeneity; energy & wage channels.

**Sources:**
- [BLS CPI: Food at home, Food away from home (monthly)](https://www.bls.gov/cpi/)
- [USDA ERS: Food Price Outlook (monthly narrative & tables)](https://www.ers.usda.gov/data-products/food-price-outlook/)
- [EIA retail fuel & energy prices (weekly/monthly)](https://www.eia.gov/)
- [BLS CES: industry hourly earnings (monthly)](https://www.bls.gov/ces/)

### 2) Shelter Costs (rent, OER, market rents)

**What to study:** CPI shelter's stickiness; market rent → CPI lags; mortgage rate environment.

**Sources:**
- [BLS CPI: Shelter, Rent of primary residence, Owners' equivalent rent](https://www.bls.gov/cpi/)
- [Zillow/Apartment List Rent Index (monthly)](https://www.zillow.com/research/data/) | [Apartment List](https://www.apartmentlist.com/research/category/data)
- [Freddie Mac PMMS mortgage rates (weekly)](https://www.freddiemac.com/pmms)
- [S&P/Case-Shiller Home Price (monthly)](https://www.spglobal.com/spdji/en/indices/indicators/sp-corelogic-case-shiller-us-national-home-price-nsa-index/)

### 3) Utilities & Home Energy (electricity, gas, water/sewer/trash)

**What to study:** Seasonal structure; energy shocks; weather load (HDD/CDD).

**Sources:**
- [BLS CPI: Electricity, Utility (piped) gas service, Water/sewer/trash](https://www.bls.gov/cpi/)
- [EIA: retail electricity & natural gas prices/consumption](https://www.eia.gov/)
- [NOAA: HDD/CDD and temperature time series](https://www.noaa.gov/)

### 4) Transportation & Fuel (gasoline, transit, auto services)

**What to study:** Oil → gasoline pass-through; asymmetry (rocket-feather); service costs.

**Sources:**
- [BLS CPI: Gasoline, Transportation services (e.g., insurance, maintenance)](https://www.bls.gov/cpi/)
- [EIA: WTI/Brent, retail gasoline (weekly)](https://www.eia.gov/petroleum/gasdiesel/)
- [BLS PPI for upstream costs](https://www.bls.gov/ppi/)

### 5) Household Services (childcare, health out-of-pocket, education, internet/phone)

**What to study:** Price stickiness; trend vs cyclical; income sensitivity.

**Sources:**
- [BLS CPI detailed services (monthly)](https://www.bls.gov/cpi/)
- [FRED health/education price indexes](https://fred.stlouisfed.org/)

### 6) Regional & Demographic Heterogeneity

**What to study:** Metro/regional CPI; urban vs non-urban; distributional burden.

**Sources:**
- [BLS regional CPI & selected metro indexes](https://www.bls.gov/regions/)
- [BEA regional price parity (annual with trend context)](https://www.bea.gov/)
- [CPS micro indicators (for demographic overlays)](https://www.census.gov/programs-surveys/cps.html)

### 7) Expectations & Sentiment

**What to study:** Do inflation expectations predict category moves?

**Sources:**
- [NY Fed Survey of Consumer Expectations (monthly)](https://www.newyorkfed.org/microeconomics/sce)
- [University of Michigan Surveys of Consumers](http://www.sca.isr.umich.edu/)
- [Market-based inflation compensation (breakevens via FRED)](https://fred.stlouisfed.org/)

### 8) Supply Chains & Commodities

**What to study:** Import prices, shipping costs, ag/industrial commodities → retail.

**Sources:**
- [BLS Import/Export Price Indexes](https://www.bls.gov/mxp/)
- [FAO Food Price Index](https://www.fao.org/worldfoodsituation/foodpricesindex/)
- Freight indices (e.g., Drewry/FBX—if accessible)

### 9) Policy Episodes & Regime Shifts (e.g., COVID-19, tightening cycles)

**What to study:** Before/after analyses, breaks, and time-varying pass-through.

**Sources:**
- [Federal Reserve monetary policy timeline](https://www.federalreserve.gov/monetarypolicy.htm)
- Fiscal policy events (Treasury/Congressional sources)
- CPI category histories (BLS)

### 10) Forecasts & Scenarios (12–24 months)

**What to study:** Conditional paths: if core inflation/energy follows a path, where do costs go?

**Sources:**
- Consensus forecasts (e.g., Survey of Professional Forecasters)
- [EIA Short-Term Energy Outlook](https://www.eia.gov/outlooks/steo/)
- Internal model outputs (produced later)

### 11) Budget Burden & Distribution (who bears the pain)

**What to study:** Expenditure shares and effective inflation by group.

**Sources:**
- [BLS Consumer Expenditure Survey (annual/quarterly detail)](https://www.bls.gov/cex/)
- [CPI weights and category shares](https://www.bls.gov/cpi/tables/relative-importance/home.htm)

### 12) Nowcasting & High-Frequency Signals (optional)

**What to study:** Weekly/daily signals that anticipate monthly CPI subcomponents.

**Sources:**
- EIA weekly fuel
- Card-type or scanner data if accessible
- Web-scraped price indicators (methodology-dependent)
